Law Enforcement Use Case


Objective:

The project aims to analyze audio conversations between two people, such as an officer and a probable suspect, by evaluating emotions, sentiments, tone, and other attributes of both speakers. Additionally, the project seeks to develop a dynamic chatbot to provide deeper insights into these conversations.


Approach:

Collect and Compress Audio:

  • Gather the raw audio file.
  • Compress it to within 25 MB if needed.

Transcription:

  • Transcribe the audio using the OpenAI Whisper model.

Speaker Diarization:

  • Send the transcribed text to GPT-4O for identifying different speakers.

Insight Extraction:

  • Analyze the diarized text for sentiment, tone, emotion, and profanity using Hugging Face models or OpenAI prompts.

Chatbot Development:

  • Create a chatbot with LangChain and Chroma DB for dynamic querying of insights from the conversation.


Significance:

  • Facilitates detailed analysis of audio conversations for investigative purposes.
  • Provides insights into emotions, sentiments, and tone of both speakers.
  • Helps in understanding various attributes of the conversation, contributing to a more comprehensive investigation.
  • Enhances the investigation process by identifying subtle cues and patterns in speech.
  • Supports deeper analysis through a dynamic chatbot, making it easier to obtain detailed information and insights.
  • Improves the accuracy and effectiveness of investigations by leveraging advanced audio analysis techniques.


Outcomes:

  • Accurate transcription of audio files using OpenAI Whisper, ensuring clarity and fidelity.
  • Identification and segmentation of speakers in conversations through GPT-4O's diarization process.
  • Detailed analysis of conversation attributes such as sentiment, tone, emotion, and profanity, enhancing understanding.
  • Development of a robust chatbot using LangChain and Chroma DB for retrieving and generating insights dynamically from conversations.
  • Improved efficiency in accessing and utilizing insights from audio conversations for decision-making and analysis.
